definition: there can never be too much deception in war/in war nothing is too deceitful/all's fair in war
soldiers/a force/an army/weapons/arms/military/warlike/CL:個|个[ge4]
(negative prefix)/not/no
to loathe
to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff

sentences.english: This is typical of the negotiation tactics of all is fair in war.
sentences.chinese: 这是商务谈判战术中典型的兵不厌诈。

sentences.english: All is fair in war, he attacked the spirit of the weak thousand unreal.
sentences.chinese: 兵不厌诈，他袭击了虚弱的灵千幻。

definition: to conspire openly/overt plot
art of war/military strategy and tactics
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
lit. an arrogant army is bound to lose (idiom)/fig. pride goes before a fall
see 成則為王，敗則為寇|成则为王，败则为寇[cheng2 ze2 wei2 wang2 , bai4 ze2 wei2 kou4]
to catch an enemy off guard with a surprise attack (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4

definition: Only an outstanding talent can recognize current trends (idiom). A wise man submits to circumstances.
pinyin: shi2 shi2 wu4 zhe3 wei4 jun4 jie2

definition: to emerge victorious in every battle/to be ever-victorious
to win by a surprise move
stratagem/scheme
How do you catch the tiger cub without entering the tiger's lair? (idiom); Nothing ventured, nothing gained.
pinyin: bu4 ru4 hu3 xue2 , yan1 de2 hu3 zi3

definition: trick/ruse/crafty scheme
lit. a wise person reflecting a thousand times can still make a mistake (idiom); fig. nobody is infallible
pinyin: zhi4 zhe3 qian1 lu:4 , bi4 you3 yi1 shi1

definition: psychological warfare/psychological operations/psyop
crafty plots and machinations (idiom)
The Thirty-Six Stratagems, a Chinese essay used to illustrate a series of stratagems used in politics, war, and in civil interaction/all the possible schemes and stratagems
